title: Sr. Program Manager – WW Logistics BPR
summary: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. As a Senior Program Manager, within WW Business Process Re-Engineering supporting the Apple Logistics teams, you will be driving large scale initiatives, cross functionally and cross regionally. These initiatives are to add new supply chain capability, drive process optimization, increased scale & efficiency, and minimize cost.
description: You will have the ability to lead medium to large size, global cross-functional projects. You will also be responsible for leading and identifying business process re-engineering opportunities. This role requires a deep understanding of logistics operations throughout the supply chain to handle complex, global initiatives. You will be responsible for leading cross-organizational teams to define, build and roll-out innovative technology and business process solutions that improve customer satisfaction, builds customer loyalty, drive revenue and increase efficiencies. The role will work with senior management and global teams to define process and capability roadmaps, driving improvements of the organization, processes and use of systems and data for Apple's Logistics teams. This effort is directly linked to our Global Logistics strategy and needs to be forward-looking.
preferred_qualifications: 10+ years of broad supply chain management exposure with expertise in a specific area to include warehouse management, logistics, fulfillment, transportation, global trade compliance, procurement or supply chain operations. Customer Focused: Passionate about both internal and external customer experience and improve it continuously. Team Player: Excellent cross-functional communication & influencing skills. Ready to deep dive into technical areas when needed and the ability to review these topics with non-technical audiences. Priority Driven: Comfortable working in a constantly changing and dynamic environment, driving top issues to resolution. Shown ability to handle deadlines and meet cost constraints. Executive Presence: Ability to summarize key points and tie them back to the customer experience & business objectives. Innovations: Passionate about learning new technologies and apply them to DC and/or logistics operations. MS or MBA in related field (Manufacturing, Mechanical, etc.) is preferred
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $171,900 and $258,700, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits. Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.
